page.title: 05INDUSTRY IN TOFTWOOD
page.content: Rashes Green is an industrial estate built in the early 1970s by Breckland District Council, to try and attract new industry to the area. It was built in Toftwood to be near the new Dereham bypass and away from the town centre. In the part of Rashes Green we surveyed there were 585 jobs distributed between 21 companies making various industrial products. The biggest single employer on this estate is the Toftwood Division of Crane Fruehauf which employs over 300 people, making specialized trailer units for lorries. Large numbers of these trailers are sold all over the world and the British armed forces is an important customer. The second largest firm on this estate is the Bally Shoe Company who own a number of factories in the region. They employ 59 people making shoes.
